title: Does footage exist in the US National Archives of the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand? - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe the footage you're asking about is perhaps online via Pathe, e accent grave, pardonez moi. Austro-Hungarian Arch Duke Ferdinand, and as a European assassination, generally in command of all the advance communications of the era, Pathe I believe is based in Britain, London I think, to be more specific. Their enormous video library is recently online, and as far as I know, I think you can watch the video of the Pathe News Reel depicting the actual incident; the film of the Dukes last breaths in the few remaining moments immediately after the gun play. A very brief video, but yes, it's pretty explicit, not gory, but explicit: the film is black and white, the timing of human movement and motion is odd; and silent. /t

No, there was no reason for a movie crew to be filming the archduke being driven through the streets of Sarajevo. There are films of reenactments, but that’s it. Individuals didn’t start making home movies until years later.
